content:
Thoughts on the following sounds, for desktop notification? I don't have an opinion yet on their merits relative to the paid sounds, but they seem to be the best of the sounds from rocket.chat and mattermost:
highbell.mp3
seasons.mp3
bing.mp3

The rest of their sounds are at
https://github.com/mattermost/mattermost-server/tree/v3.7.3/webapp/images
https://github.com/boonex/rocket.chat/tree/master/public/sounds

I like the current default sound, because it is subtle and not annoying. The high pitched bell sounds (rocketchat) always freak me out, especially on laptop speakers. Anyway, I have a studio over here, and I'll make a few custom sounds :)

@Rishi Gupta Here you go https://github.com/Alex-CodeLab/audiofiles/tree/master/wav

These sounds where created today and are royalty free. Let me know if you like it and want to use some of them.
I like several of those @Alex-CL! Does it make sense to rename the files to have more descriptive names so it's a bit easier to talk about them?

actually, it is quite difficult to name these. :big_smile:
I have no idea how to even start.
I could make it shorter (the first part is all the same, based on year/date, and remove that)
maybe if we call them A, B, C, D, etc? (A-1308 would also be fine)
Yeah, letters would be reasonable :slight_smile:
numbers also work, thanks! Thanks a lot for making these :).

@Alex-CL would you be up for changing the license (https://github.com/Alex-CodeLab/audiofiles/blob/master/LICENSE) to be a CC-BYor Apache 2 license rather than GPL3? It'd be nice for us to not have to add a GPLv3 thing to our codebase, since we're an Apache 2.0 project.
Done.
Awesome, thanks!
I guess this is a fine place to use our experimental poll feature.
/poll

(And obligatory link to https://github.com/zulip/zulip/issues/11010 since the experimental poll feature needs some UI cleanup; I'd love volunteers with design skills to contribute to that, as it's a pretty accessibly part of the codebase)
https://github.com/Alex-CodeLab/audiofiles/tree/master/wav
At least for me, it's fairly awkward to test these sounds from the GH UI.
Yeah, what I did was clone the repo and then play the sounds individually with vlc

Alright, voted for the ones I like most, though I actually like a lot of Alex's sounds. Would really really appreciate it if 5-10 other people did the same, since we'll probably want to offer <10 sounds to avoid being overwhelming.

@Steve Howell
links now included in https://github.com/Alex-CodeLab/audiofiles/blob/master/README.md . I guess most browsers play the files just by clicking the link.
/poll Additional sound options from notificationsounds.com

I guess a poll closes after some time? because I can't vote.
I click a button, but nothing happens and I can't see why.
The polls should never close, so I'm not sure what's happening for you. You can try reloading the page to see if that fixes it.
Clicking buttons works for me...
works for me too

ok, it works for Boris his poll, but not the previous one. Or am I excluded from that :grinning_face_with_smiling_eyes: ( just nothing happens)

[edit] ok, after reloading the page it works. but I tried a few times earlier today and it also didnt work. There was nothing in the browser console.
Weird. Steve may have some ideas for debugging?
I'd open up the browser console just to see if anything is being reported. Be sure that you're not double clicking, since it's a toggle. And then try to reload.
I also had some similar issues (needed to reload the page to be able to click on stuff)
but for me it happened on the original poll (Alex's)

Interesting. In early versions of this, we had some bugs when you moved between narrows, but one of summer students fixed it, and I've never seen glitches since then. If you can find an exact repro, I'd be interested.

@Tim Abbott @Rishi Gupta @Greg Price @Steve Howell @Vishwesh Jainkuniya @Jack Zhang Request for vote on the sounds I posted at https://chat.zulip.org/#narrow/stream/101-design/subject/new.20sounds/near/672052

In such cases, I will provide all sounds to user and let him select :P
My phone is on vibrate 24*7, so I don't have much preference about any sound :slight_smile:
If it is about vibrations pattern, then I can tell :stuck_out_tongue_wink:

hey, sorry for necroing this, my company recently introduced zulip and and I have found myself not liking the notification sounds, as the zulip is too subtle and the ding is a little harsh.
So I quickly made some notification sounds specifically for zulip (and anyone else who might want to use them), maybe we can get some of them into the project? They are available on freesound and github, licence is CC0.
@Stefan Sure, I would consider making a PR.
@Stefan awesome! I'd love to incorporate some of these.
(I think mostly we just need to pick a set we like and names for them). @Aman Agrawal would you be up for going through Stefan's sounds and making a draft proposal of a set to include?
(I think we mostly just need to put them in static/audio/notification_sounds/ in the right formats to add some)
And I'd prefer to favor action over inaction here.
Okay, I am mostly done with GIPHY work, I will take it up after that.
amazing, thanks guys!
Opened #17120.

@Stefan do you have sound files for what Anders Kaseorg is talking about in this comment.

I note that all of these are tonal sounds that are good for grabbing attention, but it might also be nice to have more subdued atonal options along the lines of zulip.ogg?
Also, if you don't mind, can you provide your full name for copyright purposes?
sorry for the late reply, my full name is "Stefan Mertens". I'm excited about getting these merged! :celebration:
Thanks, will update the PR with your name.
